If he ends up in Siberia, you will go with him, right? And you will need money for him. Do you understand? Giving you money is like giving it to him. Also, you promised Amalia Ivanovna to pay what is owed. I heard you. Why would you take on such responsibilities so carelessly, Sofya Semyonovna? It was Katerina Ivanovna’s debt, not yours, so you shouldn’t have paid attention to the German woman. You can’t get by in life like that. 

If anyone asks about me tomorrow or the day after, don’t mention my visit and don’t show the money or talk about it. Well, goodbye. (He stood up.) “Say hi to Rodion Romanovitch for me. You should keep the money with Mr. Razumihin for now. You know him, right? He’s a good guy. Take it to him tomorrow or when you can. Until then, hide it well.”

Sonia jumped up from her chair and looked at Svidrigaïlov in worry. She wanted to ask something but didn’t know how to start. 

“How can you leave now in such rain?” 

“Why would I let rain stop me from going to America? Ha, ha! Goodbye, Sofya Semyonovna, my dear! Live a long life; you will help others. Oh, and tell Mr. Razumihin I say hi. Tell him Arkady Ivanovitch Svidrigaïlov sends his greetings. Make sure you do.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov advises Sonia to keep money safe for her betrothed and to be discreet about their interactions.
